instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> data recovery
threads.message:
customer doenst want to fix <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ( L/B, screen, battery, too expensive) but want the data. i have the adapter for the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/8/7 but afaik there is no connector on these. is there a way to the data

TIA

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> data recovery
threads.message:
Read this...
[url]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/47985-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-the-pleasure-of-the-soldered-ssd-and-no-data-recovery-port[/url]
